title: Creating a reading list on fine-grained interpretation and causation analysis in deep neural network NLP models involves selecting articles that cover a range of techniques and perspectives. Hereâ€™s a list of 20 articles up to 2021 that you might find useful
- While primarily about the Transformer model, it introduces attention mechanisms that are crucial for interpretability
**"A Survey on the Interpretability of Neural Networks"** by Montavon et al
- Provides a comprehensive overview of interpretability methods applicable to NLP
**"Interpretable and Explainable Deep Learning: A Survey"** by Zhang et al
- Discusses various interpretability techniques, including those for NLP
- Proposes a method for generating rationales for model predictions
Local Interpretable Model-Agnostic Explanations"** by Ribeiro et al
- Introduces a model-agnostic approach to interpretability that can be applied to NLP models
**"Anchors: High-Precision Model-Agnostic Explanations"** by Ribeiro et al
note: - Builds on LIME to provide more precise explanations.

title: **"Visualizing and Understanding Neural Models in NLP"** by Li et al
- Focuses on visualization techniques for understanding NLP models
**"DeepLIFT: Learning Important Features Through Propagating Activation Differences"** by Shrikumar et al
- Introduces a method for attributing the output of a neural network to its input features
**"Integrated Gradients: Axiomatic Attribution for Deep Networks"** by Sundararajan et al
- Proposes a method for attributing predictions to input features
**"Explaining Black Box Predictions and Unveiling Data Artifacts through Influence Functions"** by Koh and Liang
- Uses influence functions to understand model predictions
**"Contextual Decomposition for Neural Network Interpretability"** by Murdoch et al
- Introduces a method for decomposing neural network predictions into interpretable components
**"Evaluating and Enhancing the Robustness of Neural Network-based Dependency Parsers"** by Belinkov and Bisk
- Discusses robustness and interpretability in the context of dependency parsing
**"Learning Important Features Through Propagating Activation Differences"** by Shrikumar et al
note: - Focuses on feature importance in neural networks.

title: **"Towards a Rigorous Science of Interpretable Machine Learning"** by Doshi-Velez and Kim
- Discusses the principles of interpretability in machine learning
**"The Building Blocks of Interpretability"** by Olah et al
- Explores interpretability through the lens of feature visualization
**"Attention is not Explanation"** by Jain and Wallace
- Critically examines the use of attention mechanisms as explanations
**"A Benchmark for Interpretability Methods in Deep Neural Networks"** by Hooker et al
- Proposes a benchmark for evaluating interpretability methods
- Discusses adversarial examples and their implications for model interpretability
**"The Mythos of Model Interpretability"** by Lipton
- Provides a critical perspective on what interpretability means in machine learning
**"Counterfactual Explanations without Opening the Black Box: Automated Decisions and the GDPR"** by Wachter et al
- Discusses counterfactual explanations in the context of legal requirements
These articles cover a range of topics from foundational concepts to specific techniques and critical perspectives on interpretability and causation analysis in NLP models
